tasks.task: Setting up the Dirt Dog disc harrow on the Kubota M4 tractor
subtasks: Attaching the disc harrow to the Kubota M4 using the three-point hitch.
Connecting hydraulic lines, if necessary, to lower the disc into the ground.

tasks.task: Adjusting the disc harrow angle settings
subtasks: Moving the gang angle settings on the disc from most aggressive to less aggressive.
Ensuring all gangs are aligned in different positions as per the operator's needs for various passes.

tasks.task: Driving the tractor through different field areas
subtasks: Moving from the previously tilled area where a subsoiler was used.
Heading to the virgin land that hasn't been worked in over a decade.
Making multiple passes over each area—going down and back two times each.

tasks.task: Operating the disc harrow and adjusting settings during tillage
subtasks: Using the hydraulic top link to adjust the disc depth during operation.
Adjusting tractor speed to match the disc's performance, noting when it feels like it's floating over the ground.
Checking for uneven soil and clumps, perhaps getting out of the tractor toinspect certain areas.
Comparing the tilled land to the virgin land, noting differences in soil clumping and consistency.
Observing the efficiency of the disc in breaking up heavy matter in the virgin soil.

subtasks: Attaching the scraper kit to the disc (the U brackets and rods).

subtasks: Aligning the disc to the three-point hitch.

Inspecting the results, noting any remaining clumps or inconsistencies.
